turns.content: Act like social media manager, i need to find a way that when we post something on Linkedin, the employees get notified and could re-post

As a social media manager, one way to ensure that your employees get notified when you post something on LinkedIn is to encourage them to follow your company's LinkedIn page. You can also create an employee advocacy program that incentivizes them to share your company's posts on their own LinkedIn profiles.

Here are some steps you can take to get started:

1. Create a LinkedIn company page if you haven't already done so.
2. Invite your employees to follow your company page by sending them a link and a brief message encouraging them to stay up-to-date with company news and updates.
3. Regularly post content on your company page, including industry news, company announcements, and employee spotlights. Be sure to include engaging visuals and calls-to-action to encourage engagement.
4. Set up an employee advocacy program that rewards employees for sharing your company's LinkedIn posts on their own profiles. This could include incentives like gift cards, company swag, or recognition in company meetings or newsletters.
5. Use a social media management tool like Hootsuite or Buffer to schedule and post content on a regular basis. These tools also allow you to track engagement metrics and see which posts are resonating with your audience.

By following these steps, you can increase employee engagement with your company's LinkedIn page and encourage them to share your content with their own networks.
